reviews.review: Loved It....... but wasn’t prepared for the ending.
Changing the skin color and eyes of Thanos ruined the movie for me. I dont see him as the Thanos I grew up expecting and knowing.
The best avengers movie so far.

The marvel cinematic universe has always made decent if not great movies, however by far this is one of the best. 60 characters,6 stones,  4 world's, 1 fake eye all crammed very well into one movie. Not to mention the relatable, and perfect acting of Thanos.
Epic! That’s all I can say for Infinity Wars! Last 10 years have been building up to this amazing movie! Loved every minute of it
Prefer Solo.  It's a good movie if you don't mind a simple plot. If you're above 13 and less than 24 you may like this movie.

Reply review to Matthew Toomey's review of Avengers: Infinity Wars.

You make a great point about the general bias of the Marvel fanbase in your first paragraph. However, I'd have to argue that your fanship lends to an overrated review. There are a few logical appeals in your review, by stating several facts that imply the movie was quality made, such as "a reported cost of $300-$400 million USD" and "intense music score from Alan Silvestri." In the review, these facts imply the movie to be great, but instead are simply facts about the movie and nothing more. 

Applying the Dr. Gan's 7 Keys to the movie would show that the movie was fair at best, but severely lacking in one department: truth-filled. While I agree with the facts of Matthew Toomey make this production skillfully-made, and the teamwork displayed in the movie (even by members who didn't know they were on the same team) respected the dignity of the human person, and perhaps the attitude awareness of the movie could relate to speaking up against tyrants (???), I think that this movie was for hardcore Marvel fans to just watch their heroes on a screen for two hours. This movie lacked truth as it was merely a narrative of the Avengers and friends fighting (largely unsuccessfully) against yet another evil villain who is putting the universe in danger yet again. There was nothing didactic or even individualistic about this movie.
Still Holds up as a Stellar Superhero Adventure Film, Childhood fantasy turns reality in the Big Screen.
Surprising is all I have to say. The only real problems I can think of is the lack of character interactions (Tony and Steve) and that it isn't really an "Avengers" film.
